"""All those traveling to Bangladesh must complete a Passenger Health Declaration Form (HDF) within three (3) days of arrival in Bangladesh. The HDF will generate a QR code, which travelers must be ready to present to immigration authorities upon arrival at the port of entry.  Travelers who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19, regardless of port of entry, can enter Bangladesh with official proof of vaccination.  No PCR or any other negative COVID-19 test is required.  The government of Bangladesh defines fully vaccinated as having received a full regimen (one or two doses, as applicable) of a WHO-approved vaccine.? At present, a booster dose is not required.  Travelers who are not fully vaccinated against COVID-19 must carry a negative COVID-19 RT PCR test report from a test taken within 72 hours of departure."""  https://web.archive.org/web/20220621074655/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20220621082359/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bangladesh/entry-requirements

"""The?government?of Bangladesh?has provided a list of recommended COVID-19 testing facilities for international passengers?here. ?Those wishing to get tested will have to pay for their own COVID-19 test.??Results are?often?delivered via text message and are, in most cases,?linked to a QR code.  In Dhaka, it is relatively easy to secure test results within 24 hours, if not faster.""  https://web.archive.org/web/20220621074655/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/"

As of March 28, all public transport services must resume its routine schedule. The testing requirement for all essential drivers will be discontinued.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220403032619/https:/www.gov.bt/covid19/27-03-22-%F0%9D%90%8F%F0%9D%90%AB%F0%9D%90%9E%F0%9D%90%AC%F0%9D%90%AC-%F0%9D%90%AB%F0%9D%90%9E%F0%9D%90%A5%F0%9D%90%9E%F0%9D%90%9A%F0%9D%90%AC%F0%9D%90%9E-%F0%9D%90%8F%F0%9D%90%A1%F0%9D%90%9A/

Relaxation measures continue to be introduced in Bhutan.    As of April 4th, The mandatory quarantine and testing for domestic travellers from high-risk areas are being withdrawn hereon. The high-risk areas include Thimphu, Wangduephodrang, Dukti chiwog under Yallang gewog and Jangphutse-Manam villages under Toedtsho gewog in Trashiyangtse, Merak and Sakteng gewogs in Trashigang and all bordering areas in southern Bhutan. They need not undergo home quarantine, either at place of origin or destination. Individuals who have entered home quarantine on or before April 3 will be allowed to travel on the enforcement date.     https://archive.ph/pyvOm
No policy change - https://web.archive.org/web/20220627204233/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/

Visitors who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 are currently required to undergo five days quarantine in Government-controlled facilities upon arrival into Bhutan, normally hotels. You may be required to show proof of vaccination .    https://web.archive.org/web/20220611232854/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bhutan/entry-requirements
No policy change - https://web.archive.org/web/20220627204233/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/

The government announced a National Resilience Fund for mitigating COVID-19 linked to job losses and salary cuts. The support included grants for individuals directly affected by the pandemic (now extended until June 2022) and a full interest waiver on loans contracted from April 10, 2020, until June 2020. These measures were extended until September 2020, and partial (50 percent) interest waivers will continue until June 2022.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220305045842/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
No policy change - https://web.archive.org/web/20220627204233/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/

The health ministry along with the Drug Regulatory Authority (DRA) has approved the use of COVID-19 antigen self-test kits in the country. The ministry approved the emergency use of the test kit as an increasing number of people are able to access it. Pharmacies registered with the DRA will be allowed to sell or distribute self-test kits.    However, individuals testing positive on self-test kits must report to 1010 for registration and monitoring by the clinical teams. The ministry will then facilitate immediate follow-up for vulnerable groups and monitor long COVID conditions.    Currently, there are around 60 COVID-19 testing centres across the country.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220429191007/http:/www.bbs.bt/news/?p=167880    https://web.archive.org/web/20220508193319/https:/www.gov.bt/covid19/11-04-22-%F0%9D%97%A5%F0%9D%97%B2%F0%9D%97%BD%F0%9D%97%BC%F0%9D%97%BF%F0%9D%98%81%F0%9D%97%B6%F0%9D%97%BB%F0%9D%97%B4-%F0%9D%97%BC%F0%9D%97%B3-%F0%9D%97%96%F0%9D%97%A2%F0%9D%97%A9%F0%9D%97%9C/

Vaccines are available for everyone above the age of 18 years. Bhutan has run a vaccination campaign for 12-16-year-old children, followed by 5-11-year-old children and providing booster doses to children 12-16 years old.     On April 18th, the health ministry rolled out the second booster or the fourth dose for those in the priority groups. The priority groups include the elderly above 65 years, persons with chronic medical conditions, all health workers, frontline workers and all outbound travellers above the age of 18. As per the ministry, close to 230,000 people are in the priority group.    Vaccines that have been approved include Covishield (AstraZeneca), Moderna, Pfizer BioNTech, and Sinopharm and they are fully funded by the Govt.    http://web.archive.org/web/20220418151636/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bhutan/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20220418160519/https://www.moh.gov.bt/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220418161150/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/24-03-33-covid-19-booster-vaccination-for-children-12-to-17-years-old/    https://web.archive.org/web/20220429190649/http:/www.bbs.bt/news/?p=168108
No policy change - https://web.archive.org/web/20220627204233/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/

13th Jun, COVID-19 preventative measures and restrictions are still in effect in some destinations.  These could include:  - curfews, movement restrictions, or lockdowns  - mandatory mask use  - required proof of vaccination or a COVID-19 test result to access public and private services and spaces  Before travelling, verify if specific restrictions or requirements are still in effect.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220621193017/https://travel.gc.ca/destinations/sri-lanka

There are no restrictions on movements within Nepal with a vaccination certificate. Local and private transportation are available. Public transport and personal vehicles, including taxis, are permitted in the Kathmandu valley and must adhere to COVID protocols.  Violations of local orders may result in penalties. Long distance buses may be operating in some areas of the country. Additional restrictions remain possible in many locations.   https://web.archive.org/web/20220523163119/https://np.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220307201443/http://www.xinhuanet.com/asiapacific/20220305/c56196aabeb8455abff9a196d31a61d3/c.html

Vaccinated visitors must present a certificate showing a negative RT-PCR test, taken within 72 hours of flight of first departure.  Unvaccinated people, or those unable to show that they have been fully vaccinated for at least fourteen days, are subject to free antigen tests on arrival. According to MoH Nepal, as of mid May 2022, 76.8% of the population have received the 1st dose and 68.1% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/  21 more million doses to be delivered by June 2022:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220131191839/https://mohp.gov.np/attachments/article/811/NEPAL%20COVID-19%20EMERGENCY%20RESPONSE%20AND%20HEALTH%20SYSTEMS.pdf    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/

According to MoH Nepal, as of early June 2022, 77% of the population have received the 1st dose and 68.4% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/  21 more million doses to be delivered by June 2022:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220131191839/https://mohp.gov.np/attachments/article/811/NEPAL%20COVID-19%20EMERGENCY%20RESPONSE%20AND%20HEALTH%20SYSTEMS.pdf    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/

According to MoH Nepal, as of mid June 2022, 77.1% of the population have received the 1st dose and 68.6% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/  21 more million doses to be delivered by June 2022:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220131191839/https://mohp.gov.np/attachments/article/811/NEPAL%20COVID-19%20EMERGENCY%20RESPONSE%20AND%20HEALTH%20SYSTEMS.pdf    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/

According to MoH Nepal, as of mid June 2022, 77.5% of the population have received the 1st dose and 69% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/    US donates 2.2 million doses of Pediatric COVID-19 vaccines to Nepal:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220620223334/https://thehimalayantimes.com/kathmandu/us-donates-22-million-doses-of-pediatric-covid-19-vaccines-to-nepal

According to MoH Nepal, as of late June 2022, 78.3% of the population have received the 1st dose and 69.5% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster, after six months of booster campaign.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).
